body:
@rahulg963 thank you very much for your interest in and contribution to Fineract/Mifos!  I'm an (old) volunteer who got reminded of Mifos/Fineract this week-end at the FOSDEM conference, and I'm taking a moment to help the project clean up some of it's old issues and pull requests etc.  

We were wondering whether you are still alive, and would be willing to `git rebase develop` this PR and take any previous review feedback into account?  If we don't hear from you within 2 weeks, we will take the liberty to close this PR without merging it, to avoid confusion for future new contributors looking at this repository - hope you understand and that's fair.

@rrpawar96 thank you very much for your interest in and contribution to Fineract/Mifos!  I'm an (old) volunteer who got reminded of Mifos/Fineract this week-end at the FOSDEM conference, and I'm taking a moment to help the project clean up some of it's old issues and pull requests etc.  

We were wondering whether you are still alive, and would be willing to `git rebase develop` this PR and take any previous review feedback into account?  If we don't hear from you within 2 weeks, we will take the liberty to close this PR without merging it, to avoid confusion for future new contributors looking at this repository - hope you understand and that's fair.
@ShruthiRajaram I noticed you seem to be an active reviewer, do you know if this can be merged?

@SunnyDay74 thank you very much for your interest in and contribution to Fineract/Mifos!  I'm an (old) volunteer who got reminded of Mifos/Fineract this week-end at the FOSDEM conference, and I'm taking a moment to help the project clean up some of it's old issues and pull requests etc.  

>  To utilize the multiple-thread of Java, is it good to use Thread.start() instead of Thread.run()?

They don't do the same thing, see the JavaDoc of [start](https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/Thread.html#start())() VS [run](https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/Thread.html#run())() .. I think you may have stumbled upon a small real issue here: Given that how it is now, using run() it doesn't actually really start a thread anyway, these few lines are unnecessarily complex - I think you could just remove the entire `new Thread(new Runnable() {` and simply do that line which is inside `run()` right after the if (without Thread), do you see why, and would you be willing to update this PR with that? We would love to merge a contribution from you as a First-time contributor - and hope to see more from you!

If we don't hear from you within 2 weeks, we will take the liberty to close this PR without merging it, to avoid confusion for future new contributors looking at this repository - hope you understand and that's fair.
@avikganguly01 and others , Could you please review it?
@vorburger yes, I'm interested in becoming an Apache Committer. Besides this has no conflicts at the moment and I'd kindly request @avikganguly01 to review these changes
@vorburger yes, I'm interested in becoming an Apache Committer. Besides this has no conflicts at the moment and I'd kindly request @avikganguly01 to review these changes

@vorburger yes, I'm interested in becoming an Apache Committer. Besides this has no conflicts at the moment and I'd kindly request @avikganguly01 to review these changes

Yes, @vorburger Since New PR has been raised. [#504](https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/504). You can close this PR.

> Yes, @vorburger Since New PR has been raised. [#504](https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/504). You can close this PR.

@rrpawar96 may I let you close it yourself?
@vorburger. Previous comments has been addressed and been rebase and changes have been pushed. It is in commit : 630e946d866.
@ShruthiRajaram perhaps you would like to re-review this and state if your review feedback has been addressed to your satisfaction?

Hi Michael,
As per Shruthi's comment, It seems to be a front end issue. So you may
proceed and close this as no change from Backend is required.

> @vorburger this code was already rebased with latest code

yeah, but if you rebase it again now, then Travis CI will run against it, which "proves" that your change build fine and don't break the build (see e.g. #516 for an example). [More background here](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/411fd0180c6080e4ff96c14e1fac177c0c7b9a32842cd5e67c6669f5@%3Cdev.fineract.apache.org%3E), and in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-697.

@apache/fineract-committers: Self-merging changes to Travis for enabling integration tests which shall break the build. Currently, 10+ integration tests are failing

@rrpawar96 : Great job on taking up such a significant piece of functionality 👍 

While this pr probably works fine as of now, the absence of any integration tests for the functionality introduced would make it unmaintainable from a community perspective (especially given that going forward, we will likely not be having much/any manual QA before shipping releases).

@vishwasbabu,  I will write test cases and notify community once done.
Thanks @rrpawar96 👍 . I will close this pr for now

@angelboxes did you notice that the (new) Travis CI build failed? Note:

`Building 95% > :integrationTest.googlecode.flyway.core.api.FlywayException: Found more than one migration with version '350' (Offenders: SQL '/home/travis/build/apache/fineract/build/tmp/tomcatRunWar/work/Tomcat/localhost/fineract-provider/WEB-INF/classes/sql/migrations/core_db/V350__rates.sql' and SQL '/home/travis/build/apache/fineract/build/tmp/tomcatRunWar/work/Tomcat/localhost/fineract-provider/WEB-INF/classes/sql/migrations/core_db/V350__email_from.sql');`

> SQL script needs to be re-numbered

Hi, I didn't noticed there was a more recent Travis build, I've changed the name of the script and rebased my branch. I will keep an eye on the travis build result if it fails again.
@hungnguyen2712 : Checking if test cases pass at https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/541.
> OK for me now! @ShruthiRajaram ok for you as well as-is - merge?

@vorburger , we had a call with this team last year. And we requested some change in functionality. So I prefer Ed Cable or Santosh Math to review the functionality before merging it. I have informed Santosh already and once they confirm we can merge this

@ShruthiRajaram my question was just if the points which YOU (earlier, above) raised are now adressed? Voice Calls without any public written record here and no concrete concrete code review feedback which the contributor could react to and rectify, and mention of (nice!) other people who have not commented on this PR in 7 months (!) isn't really how the open source is supposed to work... ;-) Unless you (@ShruthiRajaram) have strong objections, I am inclined to merge this. My main goal isn't this particular functionality, but wanted to encourage contributors like @angelboxes who clearly are reactive to concentrate feedback here - we should not discourage and demotivate such contributions by taking SOOO long...
@hungnguyen2712 : All existing test cases are currently. Details of the test cases failure related to this PR at https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/541

The Jira ticket at https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-698 has been updated with a sub-task for writing test cases and updating API docs. Would be a good starter task for prospective gsoc / outreachy students
@pwairuru : Since this is a simple fix. a jira ticket has been created at https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-729 and the pr merged. Please update the same if you have anything to add

@TypicalGitHubUser : Please let us know if you have the time to address these review comments anytime in the near future. @vishwasbabu , @ShruthiRajaram , if this PR is merged and since it's UI version is not yet implemented, https://github.com/openMF/community-app/issues/2997
Do you think it won't be any problem for existing functionality  if I fetch latest code from develop branch of Community App to work with latest code from develop branch of Fineract?

Santosh ,  I haven’t reviewed the code .
-> The code dosen’t contain integration tests , so we cannot determine if
it actually works without manually testing it out .

-> the code does not break any existing integrations tests , so , we can
tell that the most common loan scenarios do not break

-> The integration tests themselves have very low code coverage, so the
possibility that it might break something does exist (we have tickets on
Jira for improving code coverage and hope to make some progress on the same
in this GSOC)

-> To my knowledge, there isn’t any API breaking change introduced in the
develop branch since 1.2 release , so the community-app should continue to
work.

Apologies if my responses aren’t particularly helpful.
